response: "{ \"title\": \"Easy: Minimum Distance Between Similar Elements\", \"description\": \"Given a list of integers, find the minimum distance between any two elements that are equal. If there are no equal elements, return 0.\\n\\n#### Function Signature\\n```python\\ndef min_distance(lst: list[int]) -> int:\\n```\\n\\n#### Input\\n- `lst` (list[int]): A list of integers.\\n\\n#### Output\\n- Returns the minimum distance between any two equal elements in the input list, or 0 if there are no equal elements.\\n\", \"code\": \"def min_distance(lst: list[int]) -> int:\\n    if len(set(lst)) == 1:\\n        return 0\\n    lst = sorted((x, i) for i, x in enumerate(lst))\\n    prev_same = None\\n    min_dist = float('inf')\\n    for x, i in lst:\\n        if prev_same and prev_same[0] == x:\\n            min_dist = min(min_dist, i - prev_same[1])\\n        prev_same = (x, i)\\n    return 0 if min_dist == float('inf') else min_dist\", \"tests\": [\"assert min_distance([1, 2, 3]) == 0\", \"assert min_distance([1, 2, 1, 4]) == 2\", \"assert min_distance([1, 1, 1, 2]) == 1\", \"assert min_distance([]) == 0\"] }"
